means: 欺诈，哄骗( hoodwink的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: She had been hoodwinked into buying a worthless necklace.
sentence.Network_cn: 她受骗买了条一文不值的项链。

sentence.Network_en: Many people are hoodwinked by the so-called beauty industry.
sentence.Network_cn: 很多人都被所谓的美容业欺骗了。

sentence.Network_en: I was hoodwinked into buying fake jewels.

list.abs: he was merely wasting his time trying to hoodwink the people of the whole world and confound right with wrong .他想一手遮天，颠倒是非，这只能是徒劳的。

entry.def: If someone hoodwinks you, they trick or deceive you.

example.ex: People expect others to be honest, which is why conmen find it so easy to hoodwink people...
example.tran: 人们认为别人是诚实正直的，所以骗子很容易行骗得逞。

example.ex: Many people are hoodwinked by the so-called beauty industry.
example.tran: 很多人都被所谓的美容业欺骗了。

auth_sentence.content: We have just been hoodwinked into thinking it's all about scarcity.
auth_sentence.res_content: We have just been hoodwinked into thinking it's all about scarcity.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We have just been hoodwinked into thinking it's all about scarcity.

auth_sentence.content: Little wonder that many motorists believe they are being hoodwinked, with the Government usually seen as pilferer-in-chief.
auth_sentence.res_content: Little wonder that many motorists believe they are being hoodwinked, with the Government usually seen as pilferer-in-chief.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Little wonder that many motorists believe they are being hoodwinked, with the Government usually seen as pilferer-in-chief.
